title: Citi Opens New Building in Haiti Three Years After Earthquake
summary: Port-Au-Prince, Haiti - Citi Haiti announces the grand opening of their new offices in Port-Au-Prince. Nearly 40 employees displaced from their workspace in 2010 after the devastating earthquake will now service clients from the new offices located at the Corner of Boulevard Toussaint Louverture and Rue Frères Simmonds.
tag-1: Citi Opens New Building in Haiti Three Years After Earthquake
tag-3: Port-Au-Prince, Haiti – Citi Haiti announces the grand opening of their new offices in Port-Au-Prince. Nearly 40 employees displaced from their workspace in 2010 after the devastating earthquake will now service clients from the new offices located at the Corner of Boulevard Toussaint Louverture and Rue Frères Simmonds.
tag-4: For almost three years, Citi ran their operations from a temporary facility in order to seamlessly continue serving clients and stakeholders in the country.
tag-5: John Lopez Perez, Citi Country Officer for Haiti, says: "The opening of our new offices reinforces our commitment to the country, our clients and the community. Haiti is an important market for Citi and we will continue making a positive impact in the country. This new branch allows us to offer our clients an unparalleled setting for all their financial services."
tag-6: In addition, Citi Haiti remains committed to the development of youth in the country, and through the Citi Foundation's sound community outreach programs, the company is giving a grant to the Haitian Leadership Program (HELP) to support its project Building the Human Capital Through Education. HELP works to create, through merit and needs based scholarships, a community of young professionals and leaders who will promote a more just society in Haiti.
tag-7: "We strongly believe that education is a key factor to driving economic empowerment for the less fortunate in the Haitian Community. Citi is pleased to partner with HELP on educational programs like these, where more and more Haitians have access to quality education," added Lopez Perez. Citi has had a presence in Haiti since 1971, focusing on corporate and public sector markets. The bank has been recognized by the Central Bank of Haiti as the Best Corporate and Institutional Bank in the country.
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
